match.title: 3rd ODI
match.statusText: Bangladesh won by 3 wickets (with 6 balls remaining) (D/L method)
match.hoursInfo: 14.30 start, First Session 14.30-18.00, Interval 18.00-18.45, Second Session 18.45-22.15

dismissalText.long: c Nasir Hossain b Shahadat Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c Nasir Hossain b Shahadat Hossain 125 (128b 12x4 0x6 206m) SR: 97.65

dismissalComment.html: caught at midwicket! he bowls a length delivery, slightly slower, on the middle stump line. Dilshan flogs him towards midwicket, or so it seems, but Nasir was at the edge of the circle and times his jump to catch a very-hard hit shot. Excellent innings by Dilshan comes to an end

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera c Nasir Hossain b Mahmudullah 56 (66b 5x4 1x6 89m) SR: 84.84

dismissalComment.html: caught at point! First blow by Bangladesh! It was a short delivery outside off and KJ went for a cut, but the ball bounced a touch extra on him and he got a thick outside edge that was going over point, but Nasir times his jump to perfect and plucks it out..

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: caught at midwicket!, this time it's a good low catch that does Sanga..He came down the track to a flighted delivery, and got too close to the pitch of the ball, he cracks it hard and low towards midwicket where Anamul completes a neat catch

goes for the big shot but plays across the line to a slow delivery, the batsman misses it completely and loses his middle stump. He was aiming for the deep midwicket boundary but was completely beaten by the length and pace in that delivery

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: another one for Razzak! Angelo has had enough, he comes down the pitch and tries to hoick it over long-on, but gets beaten in the flight completely. The ball drift in a bit and squeezes in through the gap between bat and pad, the keeper does the rest. Easily done
bowls the arm ball which Kula tries to work to the leg side, he plays across the line and gets hit right in front. An easy decision for the umpire. Wicket no. 199 for Razzak
and he strikes straightaway, that is wicket no. 200 and that is is five-for too. This was full and quick on the leg stump, the batsman plays a hoick across the line and loses his leg stump

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews st Mushfiqur Rahim b Abdur Razzak 6 (9b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: another one for Razzak! Angelo has had enough, he comes down the pitch and tries to hoick it over long-on, but gets beaten in the flight completely. The ball drift in a bit and squeezes in through the gap between bat and pad, the keeper does the rest. Easily done

dismissalText.commentary: Jeevan Mendis b Sohag Gazi 5 (7b 1x4 0x6 4m) SR: 71.42

dismissalComment.html: another one goes down, beautifully bowled by Gazi! He flights it on off stump and the ball keeps coming with the angle from round the wicket, the batsman tries to defend it to the off side, but it sneaks between the gap between the bat and pad and hits the off stump

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal b Ziaur Rahman 0 (5b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: and that break has earned Bangladesh another wicket, this time it is Chandimal who plays a loose shot without moving  his feet to a length ball outside off, he chops it on back to his stumps

headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Anamul Haque c Chandimal b Mathews 40 (46b 5x4 0x6 65m) SR: 86.95

dismissalComment.html: caught by cover! Why why why! He again charges out and tries to go inside out over extra cover but ends up hitting it high in the air. Three fielder on the off side converge - two from cover and one from the deep, but it's the fielder from cover who was running outwards who takes an excellent catch with the ball coming from behind him

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain not out 33 (27b 6x4 0x6 48m) SR: 122.22

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: he has got the batsman with a quicker one. Ash went to the back foot when he should have been forward. The ball pitches around off stump and just turns in to beat the bat and hits Ash right in front. But was there an inside edge? It looks like it from the front-angle, but not very easy to tell. Ash certainly thinks so. But it looked plumb to the naked eye
goes! Reverse sweep! Why Mahmudullah Why! It was a straight delivery, pitches in line, hits him in line as the batsman misses his super cute shot!

gone! it was a brute of a delivery, short of length keeps rising on the batsman and just moves a touch away too, the batsman tries to fend it off but gets a faint edge to the keeper, the fielder erupt.

image.caption: Ziaur Rahman portrait
image.longCaption: Ziaur Rahman portrait, World Twenty20, September 14, 2012

headshotImage.caption: Zaiur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Zaiur Rahman  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: caught at extra cover! The procession continues. It was bowled quick on short of length right over the stumps, Zia moved outside leg stump and tries to slap it over extra cover, but the ball comes too quickly to him and he ends up giving a tame catch which the fielder takes diving forward

dismissalText.commentary: Jahurul Islam c Sangakkara b Mathews 26 (18b 4x4 0x6 26m) SR: 144.44

dismissalComment.html: gone! caught behind! Some sense needed here! He has already had a good over and he charges out to play what?? It was a back of length delivery wide outside off, Jahurul tries to punch it through off, gets a big outside edge straight into the hands off the keeper

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim run out (NLTC Perera) 9 (8b 1x4 0x6 20m) SR: 112.5

dismissalComment.html: gone! madness! Stupidity! Suicide! The batsman drops the ball right in front towards the bowler and they call for a single. It's in the hands of the bowler when Mush is parallel to him trying to get to the other end. He could have taken an aim for 10 seconds and done the job, but Thisara hits it in one go. Gone by miles

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah lbw b Senanayake 6 (7b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 85.71

dismissalComment.html: goes! Reverse sweep! Why Mahmudullah Why! It was a straight delivery, pitches in line, hits him in line as the batsman misses his super cute shot!

dismissalText.commentary: Mominul Haque c Sangakkara b Malinga 11 (9b 1x4 0x6 15m) SR: 122.22

dismissalComment.html: gone! it was a brute of a delivery, short of length keeps rising on the batsman and just moves a touch away too, the batsman tries to fend it off but gets a faint edge to the keeper, the fielder erupt.

batsmen.shot: off side drive on front foot

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: short of length delivery on off, the batsman tries to play a tennis forehand, gets a top edge over the keeper's head

commentPostTextItems.html: The two captains share the ODI trophy. Mohammad Isam and Andrew Fernando will dissect the match in their post-match pieces, but I am done with my duty. It's been a pleasure. Devashish Fuloria signing off. Ciao ciao.

Mushfiqur Rahim: "It's a huge win for us, it was a challenge for us to do well against big teams, so very happy with the effort. We have not been in such situations before and that's why the boys were panicking, but we pulled it off. Nasir is one for the future and he showed it again."

Angelo Mathews: "We were disappointed as we had runs on the board. The bowling let us down today, we batted brilliantly even though we lost out way in the middle. Senanayake has been brilliant, Kula had an off day today, but he is a great bowler for Sri Lanka."

Dilshan is also the Man of the Match and the Man of the Series:"I am in great form since the Test matches, but today being in the losing side has hurt. I like this pitch, I think this is the best wicket in Sri Lanka. Marvan has helped me tweak some issues in my batting and that has helped me in my batting."
Thirimanne gets an award for hitting two sixes, Dilshan gets a prize for fastest fifty, Abdul Razzak wins a smartphone for being a smart player, Nasir wins an award for being Bangladesh's MVP

What a thriller here! If not for Nasir, I think this match was going very quickly towards Sri Lanka. Bangladesh have won the match by three wickets and this is their best result in a bilateral series in Sri Lanka. It didn't look like it was going to get this close an hour ago when they needed 105 off 80 balls. Bangladesh started frantically and then, they started giving it all away. But for Nasir's 33, it could have been a very different story. So Bangladesh share the ODI trophy after the second match was washed out. All in all, that rain-break actually spiced up the contest and I was shaking here while watching it, so apologies if I had got carried away..Stick around for the presentation ceremony please.
Shad: "a very pakistan-esque victory there. taking a commanding position and turning it into a heart stopping, mad, nonsensical display of panic. glad they came up winners though."
zak: "I am recommending Nasir as BD batting coach!!"
uza fazzy: "Tissara Perera is well tested under pressure with his bowling and we witnessss.. :("

Orko: "Congrats BD!! Doesn't matter how you win so long as you win right? Still I feel most of us would have preferred for this win to be cleaner. This alone says how much BD has improved, we fans now want them not just to win but win well!"
chaminda: "Credits to Pallekele grounds staff not Thisara, remember B'desh !"
Mahtab Alam: "Funny how good things happen to BD team when Tamim is left out. First test drawn and this match won with the exclusion of Tamim. Either Tamim is bad luck or Mominul is good luck."
Omer: "Took late lunch at NY to watch what happens after the rain..totally worth it !!!"
Ron: "See why I was so happy to see you Devashish, you commentated in two Tournaments(ODI) and BD did wonders in both... thanks buddy"

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: oh my god, he cuts this short of length delivery straight to third-man, where Kula takes  a catch jumping towards the boundary, he realises he is going out of the playing area, so he lobs it back, tries to get back to catch it, but it's too far. Umpires checking if Kula has touched the rope, but i think it's a great effort. But a bit too late
short of length on the stump, he moves outside leg and slaps it to that gap at cow corner again, one bounce and four..

commentPreTextItems.html: 8 off 10... This is now in control, or at least this is what I think is in control. You never know what the batsmen are thinking

commentTextItems.html: tries to play a cute upper cut off a short of length delivery, gets beaten by the bounce
length delivery  on off stump, he gives it one proper golf swing, he hasn't timed it too well, but it's in the gap at cow corner and it trickles to the boundary
short of length deilvery, wide, wider, called a wide

commentPreTextItems.html: 17 off 12, Nasir on strike, Gazi has joined him.. Thisara is the man

commentTextItems.html: bowls a length delivery wide outside off, Nasir murders it through extra cover, beats the man at sweeper

dismissalText.commentary: Ziaur Rahman c NLTC Perera b Malinga 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

commentPreTextItems.html: Last ball of the over, can he take out another one...?
Animesh Pai: "Malinga has bowled such an over that it has pushed both teams equally closer to a win."

commentTextItems.html: caught at extra cover! The procession continues. It was bowled quick on short of length right over the stumps, Zia moved outside leg stump and tries to slap it over extra cover, but the ball comes too quickly to him and he ends up giving a tame catch which the fielder takes diving forward

commentPreTextItems.html: Two dot balls in the over. Ziaur takes strike

commentTextItems.html: another super delivery, a short one right over the stumps, the batsman gets out of the line right at the end

dismissalText.commentary: Mominul Haque c Sangakkara b Malinga 11 (9b 1x4 0x6 15m) SR: 122.22

commentPreTextItems.html: Mid-on, mid-off up in the circle
naleef: "Spin is working for SL, Can some one tell Angelo to bring Jeven Mendis to the attack?"

commentTextItems.html: gone! it was a brute of a delivery, short of length keeps rising on the batsman and just moves a touch away too, the batsman tries to fend it off but gets a faint edge to the keeper, the fielder erupt.
another short delivery, this time Nasir pulls it right in front of his face, to Mendis at deep square leg
short of length delivery, gets up chest high, the batsman does well to defend it back down the pitch
this one is way down the leg side, Sanga does well to stop that from going to the boundary

commentPreTextItems.html: 23 off the last three. One of which will be bowler by Malinga. Here comes Malinga now, this is a crucial over

commentTextItems.html: short delivery, the batsman has moved outside the leg stump and the ball is wide outside off, he stretches for it and gets an outside edge to the third-man boundary
he moves outside leg, the bowler follows him, it is driven to cover
he comes out to a quicker one and gets an inside edge to backward square leg
bowls a low full toss on leg stump, Nasir doesn't get the placement right with his sweep, hits it to deep backward square
charges down the pitch and drives the full delivery down to long-off for a single
moves outside leg and chips the full delivery over the bowler's head for  a single
he comes out of the track and takes the ball on the full, but drives it straight back to the bowler

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara lbw b Abdur Razzak 11 (10b 0x4 1x6 13m) SR: 110

dismissalComment.html: bowls the arm ball which Kula tries to work to the leg side, he plays across the line and gets hit right in front. An easy decision for the umpire. Wicket no. 199 for Razzak

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sachithra Senanayake b Abdur Razzak 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: and he strikes straightaway, that is wicket no. 200 and that is is five-for too. This was full and quick on the leg stump, the batsman plays a hoick across the line and loses his leg stump

dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga not out 5 (3b 1x4 0x6 4m) SR: 166.66

headshotImage.caption: Shahadat Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shahadat Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: caught at midwicket! he bowls a length delivery, slightly slower, on the middle stump line. Dilshan flogs him towards midwicket, or so it seems, but Nasir was at the edge of the circle and times his jump to catch a very-hard hit shot. Excellent innings by Dilshan comes to an end

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: another one goes down, beautifully bowled by Gazi! He flights it on off stump and the ball keeps coming with the angle from round the wicket, the batsman tries to defend it to the off side, but it sneaks between the gap between the bat and pad and hits the off stump

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: caught at midwicket!, this time it's a good low catch that does Sanga..He came down the track to a flighted delivery, and got too close to the pitch of the ball, he cracks it hard and low towards midwicket where Anamul completes a neat catch

goes for the big shot but plays across the line to a slow delivery, the batsman misses it completely and loses his middle stump. He was aiming for the deep midwicket boundary but was completely beaten by the length and pace in that delivery

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: another one for Razzak! Angelo has had enough, he comes down the pitch and tries to hoick it over long-on, but gets beaten in the flight completely. The ball drift in a bit and squeezes in through the gap between bat and pad, the keeper does the rest. Easily done
bowls the arm ball which Kula tries to work to the leg side, he plays across the line and gets hit right in front. An easy decision for the umpire. Wicket no. 199 for Razzak
and he strikes straightaway, that is wicket no. 200 and that is is five-for too. This was full and quick on the leg stump, the batsman plays a hoick across the line and loses his leg stump

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalComment.html: caught at point! First blow by Bangladesh! It was a short delivery outside off and KJ went for a cut, but the ball bounced a touch extra on him and he got a thick outside edge that was going over point, but Nasir times his jump to perfect and plucks it out..

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Anamul Haque c Chandimal b Mathews 40 (46b 5x4 0x6 65m) SR: 86.95

dismissalComment.html: caught by cover! Why why why! He again charges out and tries to go inside out over extra cover but ends up hitting it high in the air. Three fielder on the off side converge - two from cover and one from the deep, but it's the fielder from cover who was running outwards who takes an excellent catch with the ball coming from behind him

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Ashraful lbw b Senanayake 29 (38b 5x4 0x6 51m) SR: 76.31

dismissalComment.html: he has got the batsman with a quicker one. Ash went to the back foot when he should have been forward. The ball pitches around off stump and just turns in to beat the bat and hits Ash right in front. But was there an inside edge? It looks like it from the front-angle, but not very easy to tell. Ash certainly thinks so. But it looked plumb to the naked eye

headshotImage.caption: Jahurul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jahurul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jahurul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jahurul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Jahurul Islam c Sangakkara b Mathews 26 (18b 4x4 0x6 26m) SR: 144.44

dismissalComment.html: gone! caught behind! Some sense needed here! He has already had a good over and he charges out to play what?? It was a back of length delivery wide outside off, Jahurul tries to punch it through off, gets a big outside edge straight into the hands off the keeper

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim run out (NLTC Perera) 9 (8b 1x4 0x6 20m) SR: 112.5

dismissalComment.html: gone! madness! Stupidity! Suicide! The batsman drops the ball right in front towards the bowler and they call for a single. It's in the hands of the bowler when Mush is parallel to him trying to get to the other end. He could have taken an aim for 10 seconds and done the job, but Thisara hits it in one go. Gone by miles

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain not out 33 (27b 6x4 0x6 48m) SR: 122.22
Mahmudullah lbw b Senanayake 6 (7b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 85.71

dismissalComment.html: goes! Reverse sweep! Why Mahmudullah Why! It was a straight delivery, pitches in line, hits him in line as the batsman misses his super cute shot!

dismissalText.commentary: Mominul Haque c Sangakkara b Malinga 11 (9b 1x4 0x6 15m) SR: 122.22

dismissalComment.html: gone! it was a brute of a delivery, short of length keeps rising on the batsman and just moves a touch away too, the batsman tries to fend it off but gets a faint edge to the keeper, the fielder erupt.

dismissalText.commentary: Ziaur Rahman c NLTC Perera b Malinga 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: caught at extra cover! The procession continues. It was bowled quick on short of length right over the stumps, Zia moved outside leg stump and tries to slap it over extra cover, but the ball comes too quickly to him and he ends up giving a tame catch which the fielder takes diving forward

Drinks: Sri Lanka - 96/0 in 17.0 overs (MDKJ Perera 47, TM Dilshan 47)

TM Dilshan: 50 off 53 balls (4 x 4)
Sri Lanka: 150 runs in 28.5 overs (173 balls), Extras 5

Drinks: Sri Lanka - 182/1 in 33.0 overs (TM Dilshan 84, KC Sangakkara 37)
Sri Lanka: 200 runs in 35.4 overs (215 balls), Extras 7
TM Dilshan: 100 off 110 balls (8 x 4)
Sri Lanka: 250 runs in 45.1 overs (272 balls), Extras 11
Sri Lanka: 300 runs in 49.6 overs (301 balls), Extras 17
Innings Break: Sri Lanka - 302/9 in 50.0 overs (HDRL Thirimanne 25, SL Malinga 5)

milestones.description: Sangakkara has scored 85 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for SL breaking Jayasuriya's record

stories.title: Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 2012-13
stories.subTitle: 3rd ODI, Pellekele
stories.seoTitle: Sri Lanka v Bangladesh: Wisden Almanack review
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the third ODI, Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 2012-13

stories.title: Razzak draws strength from career setbacks
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh in Sri Lanka 2012-13
stories.seoTitle: Razzak draws strength from career setbacks
stories.summary: Abdur Razzak, the Bangladesh left-arm spinner, thought he would miss the chance to complete 200 ODI wickets in the three-match series against Sri Lanka

image.caption: Abdur Razzak took five wickets
image.longCaption: Abdur Razzak took five wickets, Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, Pallekele, March 28, 2013

stories.title: 'I like to be a hero at the end' - Nasir
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, Pallekele
stories.seoTitle: 'I like to be a hero at the end' - Nasir Hossain
stories.summary: Nasir Hossain's composed innings have become a feature of Bangladesh's most important chases

image.caption: Nasir Hossain smashed three sixes
image.longCaption: Nasir Hossain smashed three sixes, Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Hambantota, March 23, 2013

stories.title: Sri Lanka's muddle in the middle
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, Pallekele
stories.seoTitle: Sri Lanka's muddle in the middle
stories.summary: The team committed strategic blunders during batting and in bowling despite the richness of their all-round resources

image.caption: Thisara Perera is bowled for 4
image.longCaption: Thisara Perera is bowled for 4, Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, Pallekele, March 28, 2013

stories.title: Mathews puts the blame on bowlers
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, Pallekele
stories.seoTitle: Angelo Mathews puts the blame on bowlers
stories.summary: Angelo Mathews refused to put Sri Lanka's first-ever loss to Bangladesh on home soil down to conditions, and blamed his side's bowling instead

image.caption: Lasith Malinga appeals
image.longCaption: Lasith Malinga appeals, Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, Pallekele, March 28, 2013

stories.title: 'I would still call it a calculative chase' - Mushfiqur
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, Pallekele
stories.seoTitle: 'I would still call it a calculative chase' - Mushfiqur Rahim
stories.summary: Bangladesh's captain Mushfiqur Rahim called his side's hustling victory against Sri Lanka a "calculative chase", even though there were many moments of panic

image.caption: Nasir Hossain celebrates Bangladesh's victory with Sohag Gazi

stories.title: Bangladesh level series with tight win
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, Pallekele
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh level series with tight win
stories.summary: Bangladesh scampered to a series-levelling win against Sri Lanka in the third and final ODI, in Pallekele, winning by three wickets in a rain-hit encounter

stories.subTitle: Bangladesh in Sri Lanka 2012-13
stories.seoTitle: Mushfiqur coming to terms with pressures of captaincy
stories.summary: The tour of Sri Lanka has been a test of Mushfiqur's captaincy, and he appears to have been learning to deal with the challenge

stories.title: Fearless Kusal impresses captain
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, Pallekele
stories.seoTitle: Fearless Kusal Perera impresses Angelo Mathews
stories.summary: Angelo Mathews, the Sri Lanka captain, has lauded the aggression and confidence of new batsman Kusal Perera, who helped Sri Lanka achieve two rapid starts in the first two ODIs
